p: Whereas companies normally commit to setting an SBT, submit an SBT for approval, and wait for the SBTi to validate the SBT [27], the SBTi recently sets up a dedicated target approval route for small- and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) (fewer than 500 employees) that bypasses these steps [35]. Instead, SMEs automatically have their targets approved when signing a letter committing to reducing absolute scope 1 and scope 2 GHG emissions 30% or 50% by 2030 from a 2018 base year (consistent with the ACA method for the well-below 2 °C and 1.5 °C goals, respectively) and to measure and reduce scope 3 emissions.
